title: This huge Windows security hole is letting malware hackers in - here's what you need to know
description: Hackers are using tools for cracking games to escalate privileges on compromised devices.

title: Intel is killing off its NUC mini PCs - so who will pick up the slack?
description: Though support for existing units will continue, Intel is ceding a win to the competition.

title: New Hellboy Web of Wyrd trailer has convinced me we could finally get a good Hellboy game
description: Lance Reddick is voicing the comics icon in a new roguelite brawler coming to Switch, Playstation, PC and Xbox

title: Microsoft is making some big changes to Azure Active Directory
description: The Entra brand has swallowed Azure AD as Microsoft expands its access control product range, but users needn’t do anything.

title: The new Sony A6700 brings cutting edge AI-powered autofocus to APS-C
description: The new Sony A6700 is a flagship APS-C camera with 26MP sensor, 4K video and class-leading autofocus and battery life.

title: Bluehost automates WordPress website building experience with new AI suite
description: Bluehost launches new WordPress experience with guidance from beginning to end for users to grow their online presence.

title: IBM unveils its next generation of Watson for businesses
description: IBM's AI platform goes all-in on the enterprise world with watsonx launch.

title: Windows 11 gets more AI – but is Microsoft pushing its luck?
description: The Microsoft Store now has an AI Hub, and there are more AI-powered features inbound.

title: Netflix adds an important new profile feature to help with the password crackdown
description: You no longer need to lose your Netflix profile if you're not under the same roof as the account holder.

title: Google Drive, watch out—privacy-first Proton Drive lands on Windows
description: Proton Drive's Windows app has launched, with the VPN and secure email provider claiming it will be a big step towards making privacy the default for everyone.

title: Gmail is solving one of your biggest meeting problems at last
description: Find a meeting time that works for everyone straight from a Gmail message.

title: Just signed up for Amazon Prime? These are the 5 best Prime Video movies to stream today
description: New to Amazon Prime Video and looking for something brilliant to watch? We have some suggestions.

title: Microsoft says Chinese hackers gained access to US government email accounts
description: The hackers had access for a month before being pushed out. We don't know how much damage they did.

title: We’re amazed at how well Windows 11 runs with 176MB of RAM – but don’t try this at home
description: Officially, you need over 23 times this amount of RAM to run Windows 11.

title: Data center industry set for boom, but costs are set to soar
description: Data centers will continue to grow, but that doesn’t mean they’re immune from the same challenges we all face.

title: Deutsche Bank confirms provider breach exposed customer data
description: Customers from 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2020 have been warned of a potentially harmful Deutsche Bank data breach.

title: Salesforce is hiking prices for some of its top cloud products
description: Online subscriptions are becoming more expensive, and Salesforce is passing on its increases to customers.

title: IoT is set to push 5G connections into the billions
description: By 2027, there will be ten times as many 5G connections as we have today, Juniper report claims.

title: Windows 11 just got a pile of nifty new features – and something you might hate
description: Microsoft is pushing forward with its ‘notification badging’ (read: ads) on the Start menu, sadly.

title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Wednesday, July 12 (game #534)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: When is Mission Impossible: Dead Reckoning Part One coming to Paramount Plus?
description: Here's when we expect the latest movie in the Mission Impossible series to join Paramount Plus' back catalog.
